total_revenue.fx_impact: Currency movements caused a 1.3% negative effect on total revenues and $0.01 negative on EPS

Cloud_Services_and_License_Support.context: Cloud Services and License Support revenues account for nearly three-quarters of total Company revenues, with most revenue being recurring

Cloud_License_and_On-Premise_License.context: Cloud License and On-Premise License revenues were $812 million, down 6% from last quarter, reflecting volatility typical of Q1

drivers: Key customer wins such as DP World, Shaw Communications, and Bangkok Bank of Thailand
Migration from legacy systems to Fusion ERP
Adoption by large enterprises like McDonald's and Southwest Gas

NetSuite_ERP.context: NetSuite ERP revenue growth driven by mid-20% increase

Vertical_SaaS.context: Vertical SaaS revenue growth in high single digits

Data_Cloud.context: Data Cloud revenue decline in low teens

Database_Revenue.context: Includes BYOL and Autonomous Database revenues

drivers: Increased adoption of Bring Your Own License (BYOL) models
Introduction and adoption of Oracle Autonomous Database
High customer acquisition and trial rates

context: Assumes a base tax rate of 20%
Onetime tax events may cause actual tax rates to vary
Expected to average around 20% for fiscal year 2020

share_repurchase.context: Repurchased 89 million shares for a total of $5 billion this quarter; over the last 12 months, repurchased 611 million shares for $31 billion

dividends.context: Declared a quarterly dividend of $0.24 per share

Fusion_and_Autonomous_Database.description: Growth and advancements in Fusion ERP, Fusion HCM, and the Autonomous Database
initiatives: Upgrading legacy systems to Fusion ERP and Fusion HCM
Expanding the Autonomous Database customer base
Enhancing security and reducing human error with autonomous technologies
goals: Become the largest back-office applications provider
Increase recurring revenue through cloud services
Prevent data theft and reduce operational costs with autonomous technologies
examples: DP World migrating to Fusion Financials Cloud Service
Shaw Communications upgrading to Fusion Financials Cloud Service
Bangkok Bank of Thailand upgrading their e-business suite with Fusion Financials Cloud Service and Fusion Financial Enterprise Performance Management
Envision Healthcare replacing legacy Infor Lawson system with Fusion ERP
Express Scripts migrating from Hyperion On-Premise to Fusion EPM in the cloud
Lyft transitioning ERP systems from NetSuite to Fusion
Media Newsroom winning against Workday
National Oilwell Varco expanding Fusion EPM and supply chain management
NGL Energy Partners purchasing Fusion ERP suite and supply chain management
Penn National Gaming adopting Fusion HCM
Standard Group Limited switching from Waldorf German company to Fusion
Southern Company migrating from E-Business Suite and PeopleSoft to Fusion Cloud suite
BAE Systems upgrading HR technology with Fusion HCM
Dubai Holdings expanding to Fusion HCM and Taleo for recruiting
McDonald's choosing Fusion HCM and payroll, displacing Workday's legacy systems
Nestle adopting Fusion solutions
Southwest Gas displacing SAP and Workday with Fusion
University of Texas migrating from PeopleSoft On-Premise to Fusion HCM in the cloud

Autonomous_Database.description: Introduction and expansion of Oracle Autonomous Database as a game changer in cloud services
initiatives: Automating database configuration, patching, backup, and encryption
Preventing human error to enhance data security
Promoting Autonomous Database to non-Oracle customers
Integrating Autonomous Database with other Oracle Cloud services
goals: Differentiate second-generation cloud from first-generation cloud
Reduce operational costs by eliminating human labor
Prevent data theft and catastrophic data loss
Achieve widespread adoption across various industries
examples: 7-Eleven moving all point-of-sale data to the Autonomous Data Warehouse
Cargojet Canada adopting Autonomous Database
Johnson Controls implementing Autonomous Database
LATAM Airlines migrating On-Premise data centers to OCI with Autonomous Database
Siemens Energy utilizing Autonomous Database for faster data reporting
Stanley Black & Decker enhancing analytics with Autonomous Database
Uber adopting the Autonomous Database

revenue_growth.expectation: Healthy bookings growth with continued demand for hybrid and cloud offerings
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to grow between 1% to 3% in Q2 2020
revenue_growth.fx_impact: Assuming a 1% currency headwind, total revenues are expected to grow from 0% to 2% in USD
factors: Growth in Oracle Cloud consumption and long-term contracts

eps_growth.context: Non-GAAP EPS growth in constant currency and USD, adjusted for currency headwind

drivers: Investments in GitHub and Citus Data acquisitions
Continued investment in AI and commercial sales capacity

operating_environment_challenges: Mark Hurd's absence and leadership coverage
Currency fluctuations impacting revenue and EPS
Volatility in new software license growth rates in Q1
Managing integration of acquisitions and investments
Scaling cloud infrastructure and managing costs
Ensuring data security with Autonomous Database
